feed.title: theausinstitute TikTok
feed.subtitle: OK Boomer, all the latest TikToks from theausinstitute

entry.title: "The fact that you've got two whistleblowers on trial right now in Australia... sends a really chilling effect to other whistleblowers who might be thinking about speaking up." - Kieran Pender, senior lawyer at the Human Rights Law Centre Watch the full w
entry.content: "The fact that you've got two whistleblowers on trial right now in Australia... sends a really chilling effect to other whistleblowers who might be thinking about speaking up." - Kieran Pender, senior lawyer at the Human Rights Law Centre Watch the full webinar on Whistleblowing in Australia, link in bio. #auspol

entry.title: [Pacific Island leaders] have been very clear in what they expect from Australia...when it comes to partnering to host a COP. "Is Australia really a credible host? Why should we host an event when they've ignored our requests for years?" Listen to the la
entry.content: [Pacific Island leaders] have been very clear in what they expect from Australia...when it comes to partnering to host a COP. "Is Australia really a credible host? Why should we host an event when they've ignored our requests for years?" Listen to the latest episode of our Follow the Money podcast, link in bio. #auspol #climate

entry.content: Why is the Australian Government in such a rush to ensure the Pacific's support for its COP31 bid? "The quicker Australia locks this, the harder it is for Pacific countries to renege when Australia continues expanding its fossil fuel industry." ðŸ”Š Listen to the latest ep of Follow the Money 'An Eventful Trip to Fiji' with Polly Hemming and Ebony Bennett. > https://omny.fm/shows/follow-the-money-au/an-eventful-trip-to-fiji

entry.title: "If they were fluffy koalas piled up, I think people would be a lot more outraged. But unfortunately, because they're fish, we think it's not quite as bad." On this episode of Follow the Money, Ebony is chatting with Australia Institute researcher and Men
entry.content: "If they were fluffy koalas piled up, I think people would be a lot more outraged. But unfortunately, because they're fish, we think it's not quite as bad." On this episode of Follow the Money, Ebony is chatting with Australia Institute researcher and Menindee local Kate McBride about fish kills, and the Murray-Darling Basin Plan. Listen via link in bio. #auspol

entry.title: "One of the most frustrating things to hear, particularly during those first fish kills, was politicians in particular saying that they're natural." "These fish kills are not natural and they should not happen." - Kate McBride, researcher and Menindee loc
entry.content: "One of the most frustrating things to hear, particularly during those first fish kills, was politicians in particular saying that they're natural." "These fish kills are not natural and they should not happen." - Kate McBride, researcher and Menindee local Listen to the latest episode of Follow the Money via link in bio #auspol
